glsa.title: rsync: Two buffer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Two user-assisted buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in rsync.

background.p: rsync is a file transfer program to keep remote directories synchronized.

description.p: Sebastian Krahmer from the SUSE Security Team discovered two off-by-one errors in the function "f_name()" in file sender.c when processing overly long directory names.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to synchronize a repository containing specially crafted directories, leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
